ratings.question_text: How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: Nothing toshow..
Prof. Brennan Galvin's knowledge and experience on the subject matter, and also her passion.
The small class size really benefited this class. It helped facilitate necessary discussion that would have otherwise been lost in a larger setting This class should always be taught as a seminar.

The fun atmosphere and the interesting topic. It really is the only course that discusses the big concepts surrounding global transportation challenges, and it will be missed in the overall FES curriculum. Ellen provided a great overview of various tranportation methods and prompted students to think through the pros/cons/feasibility of the different strategies for addressing transportation problems.
-class discussions, teachers-excellent guest speakers and readings
The professor
Much of the reading was of excellent quality and our professor was clearly passionate about the subject.
The lectures and the class discussions!

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: Maybe a little more structure in the lectures, but over all, the class was very enjoyable
The lectures could have been a little clearer and could the power points. Discussion could have been a more integral part of the class as opposed to just an after thought.
-more hands-on learning, trips
More cohesive in class explanations of types of transportation and focus on some of the grittier details of a few case studies rather than a vaguer addressing of more case studies.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: High quality
They were always responsive to emails and willing to meet before and after class.
Both Weixin and Ellen were very available to help as necessary.
-both instructor and TA very responsive
Both professor and TA were very helpful
When contacted, both were readily helpful and available.
Instructor - she was very helpful

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: I'm a political science major with an urban studies concentration. There is currently no other class that gives an in-depth look at transportation policy, either domestic or global.
Interested in global energy challenges/solutions, so this was a very good fit.

Transportation is a key feature to understanding human interaction with the environment; I'd feel inadequately educated were there no class analyzing transportation's relationship with the broader urban realm.

This course fits into my career as a social development professional. It helped me to understand the perspectives that guide transportation choices, the implication of current paradigms and how to manage the future.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I am interested in transportation issues and this seemed like an interesting class
It's the only transportation course we have! Don't cut it.
Interested in global energy challenges/solutions, and this was the only class that addressed the transportation aspects of this.
It is the only transportation class at Yale
The topic& the syllabus, and, honestly, the title.
To understand the role of transportation and requisite environmental stewardship for society and development.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: Yes, and more
Not really, but I still think it was a valuable experience overall.
Yes.
and more

In some ways, not in others. The class time itself could have been more productive and built on readings more in a way that encouraged everyone to read. Also, I would have liked to have more discussion time with other members of the class.
Yes!

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: Yes, and more.
I know more about transportation policy than when I went in. In that regard, yes I did.
Yes.
I'm not sure what I expected.
Yes I did

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: I enjoyed working with other students and hearing their thoughts and opinions on the topic we chose. The class is broad and covers transportation issues on a global scale, so it was very useful to break down into a small group and focus on a smaller-scale issue.
It made the final project much more enjoyable to work as a team.
Learned from my group about transportation in other parts of the world
I gained multiple perspectives and the experience of working with graduate students.
Advantages - Team work benefits and networking

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Take advantage of the readings posted online, and ask plenty of questions in class
Read the readings and take the paper seriously (and start on it early!).
Read.
Insist that this course and other courses in urban environmental management be taught at FES
